A recent version of Docker will be available as part of the HeliumOS installation. However, there are a couple of steps needed to use Docker. For rootful Docker: Enable the Docker Daemon using the terminal
```shell sudo systemctl enable --now docker.service ``` Now you can use rootful Docker with `sudo docker ps` or similar commands. If you want to use rootful Docker without sudo, see the official [Docker Engine documentation](https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/linux-postinstall/) for more details. For rootless Docker: Run the rootless Docker helper script
```shell dockerd-rootless-setuptool.sh install ``` Docker containers managed using commands such as `docker ps` will now be rootless.
